data.title: 3 reasons why the stock market rally may be stopped in its tracks
data.description: One top Wall Street strategist makes a compelling case for a pause in the market rally.
data.snippet:
It's time for sizzling stock prices to take a breather.

The market may be at that point now as summer winds to a close, one top Wall Street strategist argued.
...

highlights.highlight: And market leader Apple (AAPL) has seen its stock fall below the 50-day moving average after a mixed earnings report a week ago. Month to date, the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI), Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC), and S&P 500 (^GSPC) are all slightly lower.

data.title: Apple's $3 Trillion Valuation May Be Gone for Good
data.description: Shares of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) slipped last week following a quarterly report that was mostly bad news.  Apple's sprawling services segment was a bright spot, but it wasn't enough to push the headline numbers higher.  Apple stock had been rallying this year, briefly pushing the company's market capitalization above $3 trillion.

highlights.highlight: Shares of Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) slipped last week following a quarterly report that was mostly bad news. Apple's sprawling services segment was a bright spot, but it wasn't enough to push the headline numbers higher. Apple stock had been rallying this year, briefly pushing the company's market capitalization above $3 trillion.

data.title: 2 No-Brainer Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy in August
data.description: Warren Buffett is widely regarded as one of the most successful investors of all time, and for good reason.  Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) are both no-brainer picks this month.  Berkshire Hathaway, under the direction of Buffett protégés Ted Weschler and Todd Combs, began buying Amazon shares in 2019.
